page.title: 04FAMILY LIFE
page.content: My name is Jenny HENDERSON. I live at Udale Farm, near Jemimaville on the Black Isle. In my family there is my little brother John, my mum and my dad who runs the farm and breeds Clydedales, a type of heavy horse like the Shire. I have sixteen pets which are seven horses, four donkeys, two tortoises, one cat, one dog and a goldfish. I have plenty of things to do. For instance I can go riding my pony, play with my pets, go on bike rides or get my friend Morven up from the village. The surrounding countryside is mostly all farmland or woodland. The Black Isle is a nice place to live and I would not like to move from it. I have lived on the Black Isle all my life although we moved from near Conon-Bridge, where we had another farm, to Udale because Udale is a bigger farm.
